y = \sec^{-1}\Bigg(\frac{1}{2x^2 - 1}\Bigg), 0\lt x \lt \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\\
\Rightarrow \sec y = \frac{1}{2x^2 - 1}\\ \Rightarrow \frac{1}{\cos y} = \frac{1}{2x^2 - 1}\\ \Rightarrow \cos y = 2x^2 - 1 \\ \Rightarrow 1 + \cos y = 2x^2 \\ \Rightarrow 2 \cos^2 \frac{y}{2} = 2x^2 \\ \Rightarrow \cos^2 \frac{y}{2} = x^2 \\ \therefore x = \cos \frac{y}{2}\\
